definition: to dash/to move forward quickly/to bulge/to protrude/to break through/to rush out/sudden/Taiwan pr. [tu2]
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
item/component/classifier for events, things, clothes etc

sentences.english: Is similar to the overwhelming majority thunderbolt, the network becomes the first disseminator .
sentences.chinese: 如同絕大多數突發事件，網絡成爲最先傳播者。

sentences.english: A point man for dealing with the fast-changing events is Mr.
sentences.chinese: 處理這類突發事件的排頭兵就是戴維斯。

sentences.english: When confronting the emergencies such as earth-shake and hail disaster, people become unconsciousness of self-protection.
sentences.chinese: 人們面對地震，冰災等突發事件時缺乏自我保護意識。

sentences.english: We will improve the mechanism of emergency management.
sentences.chinese: 完善突發事件應急管理機制。

sentences.english: People in our profession often have to deal with unforseen incidents that arise suddenly .
sentences.chinese: 幹我們這一行的，經常要處理一些突發事件。

sentences.english: Chapter Four is a summary of Emergency Management.
sentences.chinese: 第四章突發事件應急管理系統總述。

sentences.english: Procedures for revealing names of members of future Emergency Committees are under review.
sentences.chinese: 目前正審議今後突發事件委員會成員姓名的披露程序。

sentences.english: Once an Incident has recurred, it should be designated as a Problem.
sentences.chinese: 一旦發生了突發事件，它就應該作爲問題指出。

sentences.english: The stock of this near disaster aggravated my congenital heart condition.
sentences.chinese: 這幾近災難的突發事件加重了我的先天性心臟衰弱。

sentences.english: Food safety issues are an additional dimension of the emergency.
sentences.chinese: 食品安全問題屬於本次突發事件的另外一面。

sentences.english: This method can provide references for urban traffic evacuation organizations in emergencies.
sentences.chinese: 該方法可爲突發事件下的城市交通疏運組織提供參考。

definition: to handle/to take care of/to punish
to be on guard/wariness/to guard against/preventive
to meet a contingency/to adapt oneself to changes
to respond to an emergency/to meet a contingency/(attributive) emergency
lit. before it rains, bind around with silk (idiom, from Book of Songs 詩經|诗经); fig. to plan ahead/to prepare for a rainy day
to oversee/to take charge of/to supervise/to administer/supervisory/supervision
variant of 動蕩|动荡[dong4 dang4]
